problem_text:
Does the free group Fη (1 < η < ∞) have a finite subset S for which there is a unique total order of Fη making all elements of S positive? Equivalently, does the free representable l-group of rank η have a basic element? (The analogs for right orders of Fη and free l-groups have negative answers.)
S. McCleary
answer: No, it does not (S. Dovhyi, K. Muliarchyk, Groups Geom. Dyn., 17 (2023), 613–632; K. Muliarchyk, Preprint, 2024, https://arxiv.org/abs/2403.14779).
